name: 2. Data Description and Profiling
content:
Data Description

The dataset consists of 420 rows and 24 features, covering weekly retail sales and pricing information.

  • Categorical Variables:
  • SIZE (Product size: S, M, L, etc.)
  • PRD_CD (Product identifier)
  • YEAR_WEEK (Time granularity: weekly)
  • Numerical Variables:
  • SALES_VOLUME (Target variable: units sold per week)
  • PACK_PRICE_PRD (Our product’s price)
  • PACK_PRICE_COMPETITOR1–5 (Competitor prices)
  • ADV_SPEND (Advertising spend per week)
  • WEEK_MIN_PRD_PACK_PRICE (Minimum product pack price observed that week)
  • LOG_* features (log-transformed versions for elasticity modeling)
  • Event/Promotion Variables:
  • BAU, EVENT, FLEETING, SVD (Indicators of promotions and special events)
  • Q1, Q2, Q3 (Quarter indicators)

Time Period Covered: Weekly data from 2023 (full year).

Granularity: Product × Week level.

Data Preparation

  1. Missing Value Handling:
  • Fill missing competitor prices (PACK_PRICE_COMPETITOR4) using forward/backward fill or competitor median pricing.
  • Impute missing product prices and log-transformed features (PACK_PRICE_PRD, LOG_SALES_VOLUME, LOG_PRD_PRICE).

2.Outlier Detection:

  • Identify unusually high/low sales or advertising spend using IQR or Z-score methods.

3.Feature Engineering:

  • Price elasticity features: ratio of product price vs. competitor minimum price.
  • Promotion impact: binary indicators for promotions (EVENT, FLEETING).
  • Seasonality: encode week and quarter effects.

4.Transformation:

  • Use log transformations for skewed variables (SALES_VOLUME, PACK_PRICE_PRD).
  • Standardize numerical features for model stability.
